nl.inl.blacklab.resultproperty

Class HitProperty

  • java.lang.Object
    • nl.inl.blacklab.resultproperty.HitProperty
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Serializable, Comparator<Hit>, ResultProperty<Hit>
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    HitPropertyContextBase, HitPropertyContextWords, HitPropertyDoc, HitPropertyDocumentDecade, HitPropertyDocumentId, HitPropertyDocumentStoredField, HitPropertyHitPosition, HitPropertyMultiple

    public abstract class HitProperty
extends Object
implements ResultProperty<Hit>
    Abstract base class for a property of a hit, like document title, hit text, right context, etc.
    See Also:
    Serialized Form

      • deserialize

        public static HitProperty deserialize(BlackLabIndex index,
                                      AnnotatedField field,
                                      String serialized)
        Convert the String representation of a HitProperty back into the HitProperty
        Parameters:
        index - our index
        field - field we're searching
        serialized - the serialized object
        Returns:
        the HitProperty object, or null if it could not be deserialized

      • sortDescendingByDefault

        protected boolean sortDescendingByDefault()
        Is the default for this property to sort descending? This is usually a good default for "group size" or "number of hits".
        Returns:
        whether to sort descending by default

      • setContexts

        protected HitProperty setContexts(Contexts contexts)
        Set contexts to use. Only ever used by constructor, so doesn't break immutability.
        Parameters:
        contexts - contexts to use, or null for none

      • setContextIndices

        protected void setContextIndices(List<Integer> contextIndices)
        For HitProperties that need context, sets the context indices that correspond to the context(s) they need in the result set. Only needed if the context indices differ from the assumed default of 0, 1, 2, ... Only called from the HitPropertyMultiple#copyWith(Hits, Contexts, boolean), so doesn't break immutability.
        Parameters:
        contextIndices - the indices, in the same order as reported by needsContext().

      • get

        Description copied from interface: ResultProperty
        Get the property value for a specific result.
        Specified by:

        Parameters:

        Returns:
        property value

      • compare

        public int compare(Hit a,
                   Hit b)
        Description copied from interface: ResultProperty
        Compares two hits on this property. The default implementation uses get() to compare the two hits. Subclasses may override this method to provide a more efficient implementation. Note that we use Object as the type instead of Hit to save on run-time type checking. We know (slash hope :-) that this method is only ever called to compare Hits.
        Specified by:
        compare in interface Comparator<Hit>
        Specified by:
        compare in interface ResultProperty<Hit>
        Parameters:
        a - first hit
        b - second hit
        Returns:
        0 if equal, negative if a < b, positive if a > b.

      • needsContext

        public List<Annotation> needsContext()
        Retrieve context from which field(s) prior to sorting/grouping on this property?
        Returns:
        null if no context is required, the fieldnames otherwise

      • needsContextSize

        public ContextSize needsContextSize(BlackLabIndex index)
        If this property need context(s), how large should they be?
        Parameters:
        index - index, so we can find the default context size if we need to
        Returns:
        required context size

        Reverse the sort order of this hit property.
        Specified by:

        Returns:

      • copyWith

        public HitProperty copyWith(Results<Hit> newHits,
                            Contexts contexts)
        Produce a copy of this HitProperty object with a different Hits and Contexts object.
        Parameters:
        newHits - new Hits to use
        contexts - new Contexts to use, or null for none
        Returns:
        the new HitProperty object

      • copyWith

        public abstract HitProperty copyWith(Results<Hit> newHits,
                                     Contexts contexts,
                                     boolean invert)
        Produce a copy of this HitProperty object with a different Hits and Contexts object.
        Parameters:
        newHits - new Hits to use, or null to inherit
        contexts - new Contexts to use, or null to inherit
        invert - true if we should invert the previous sort order; false to keep it the same
        Returns:
        the new HitProperty object

      • docPropsOnly

        public DocProperty docPropsOnly()
        Return only the DocProperty portion (if any) of this HitProperty, if any. E.g. if this is a HitPropertyMultiple of HitPropertyContextWords and HitPropertyDocumentStoredField, return the latter as a DocPropertyStoredField. This is used for calculting the relative frequency when grouping on a metadata field.
        Returns:
        metadata portion of this property, or null if there is none

      • docPropValues

        public PropertyValue docPropValues(PropertyValue value)
        Return only the values corresponding to DocProperty's of the given PropertyValue, if any. E.g. if this is a HitPropertyMultiple of HitPropertyContextWords and HitPropertyDocumentStoredField, return the latter of the two values in the supplied PropertyValue. This is used for calculating the relative frequency when grouping on a metadata field.
        Parameters:
        value - value to extract the values corresponding to DocProperty's from
        Returns:
        metadata portion of this value, or null if there is none
